intro: Paronychia jamesii, commonly known as the desert sand verbena, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a low-growing annual herb with small, pale blue or violet flowers that bloom in the summer. The plant has narrow, linear leaves and is adapted to arid environments, often found in sandy or gravelly soils. It is part of the Plantaginaceae family and is known for its ability to thrive in harsh, dry conditions. Paronychia jamesii plays a role in stabilizing soils and providing nectar for pollinators in its native habitat.
